bgm.name: bgm
bgm.description: Shows BGM playlists that the developer of this bot shares, and you can choose and play them.

bulk_delete.name: bulkdelete
bulk_delete.description: Deletes messages the bot sent. Fetches and finds in recent 1000 messages.
bulk_delete.confirm:
Press the button below to confirm bulk-deletion of messages.
If not, the operation will be automatically cancelled after a while.
bulk_delete.finish: Done! (This message will be deleted automatically)

count.description: The maximum number of messages to be deleted. This should be 100 or less.

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.description: Aborts all operations that can be canceled.
cancel.canceling: Canceling all operations that can be canceled....
cancel.noCancelable: There's no task to be canceled.

command.name: command
command.description: Shows list of commands. If you specify a command, shows details of the command.
The command to show the details.

command.toLearnMoreMessage: Like `{{prefix}}command play`, you can add a command name as an argument to display the details of that command.
command.toLearnMoreInteraction: Like `/command play`, you can add a command name as an argument to display the details of that command.
command.argumentDescription: The arguments in `<>` are required and the arguments in `[]` are optional.

effectControllPanel.title: Effect Control Panel
effectControllPanel.description:
You can enable/disable audio effects.
`-` The button appearance may not show the actual current status. They will be updated when toggling the effect, or pressing the Update button.
`-` All changes will be effected from the next song.
If you'd like to apply to the current playing song, use the command `rewind`.
effectControllPanel.footer: Choose an effect you want to apply and press the button.

end.name: end
end.description: Removes all songs from queue except for the current playing song (or the song waiting to be played).
end.queueWasEmpty: Nothing was removed because of no items or just one item in queue.
end.success: Deleted all items left in queue.

equalplayback.name: equalplayback
equalplayback.description: Plays same amount of songs for each user.
equalplayback.featureDescription: This is a function that makes it as even as possible for each user who added songs when playing songs.

export.name: export
export.description: Exports content of the queue so that it can be imported.
export.queueEmpty: Unable to export queue due to no items in queue.
export.importInstruction: When you import, set "<{{url}}>" for the argument of command `import`.

frame.name: frame
frame.description: Gets a frame image of the video at the current playback position, if possible. Gets the frame at that point if an argument is specified.

time.description: Gets the frame at that point if specified.

frame.unsupported: The source does not support the frame capture function.
frame.fallbacking: This feature is not currently available as we are using an unconventional method.
frame.liveStreamWithTime: Unable to specify the time on livestream.

help.name: help
help.embedDescription: Made for your experiences in Discord with high-quality songs
help.toLearnMore: Use {{command}} to show all available commands.
help.discordAttachmentUrl: URL specification of message with audio file attachment
help.driveShareUrl: URL specification of private link of audio file
help.spotify: Song URLs, and playlist URLs. Guess the song and play it from YouTube.

import.name: import
import.description: Imports queue from the specified message. Specify the URL of the message that has a file exported by `export` command.

url.description: URL of the message to import from. You can specify URL of the message with the ymx file attached output by export command.

import.invalidArgumentMessage: Send the URL of a message as an argument that has an exported queue.
import.noDiscordLink: Provide a link to your Discord message.
import.notBotMessage: Not a message sent by bot
import.versionIncompatible: The specified file cannot be imported because the versions are incompatible.
import.contentNotIncludedInMessage: The target content was not found.

invoke.name: invoke
invoke.description: Executes the specified command. Please do not use it basically.
invoke.recursiveInvoke: You cannot use the `invoke` command with `invoke` command.

join.name: connect
join.alreadyConnected: Already connected to the voice channel.

leaveclean.name: leaveclean
leaveclean.description: Cleans up by removing queued songs requested by people who left your voice channel.

log.name: systeminfo
log.description: Displays technical information about hosted servers and processes. You can also specify arguments (one of `mem`, `cpu`, `basic`, and `log`) to get only specific contents.

content.description: You can choose from basic, mem, cpu and log.

log.guildSearchResult: The Result of Inquiring the Server (SECRET)

loop.name: loop
loop.description: Toggles looping the current playing song.

looponce.name: looponce
looponce.description: After the current playback ends, play the same song again in a loop.

lyrics.name: lyrics
lyrics.description: Finds lyrics of the specified song.
lyrics.usage: l <ex. titles, artists and so on>
lyrics.failed: Failed to show lyrics. Please check the song name and try again.

move.name: move
move.description: Moves the song from the specified position to the specified position in the queue. If you want to move the 2nd song to the 5th, use `mv 2 5`.

from.description: Index to move from. It is written together with the queue.

to.description: Index to move to. It is written together with the queue.

move.invalidArgumentCount: Index to move to. It is written together with the queue.
move.invalidIndex: You cannot specify 0 for moving from or to while the music is playing (or paused).
move.originEqualsDestination: The source and destination songs were the same.
move.indexOutOfRange: Failed to move. The argument is out of queue range.

movelastsongtofirst.name: lastsongtotop
movelastsongtofirst.description: Moves the last song in the queue to the top of the queue.
movelastsongtofirst.usableWhen3orMoreQueue: You can use this command when 3 or more items are present in queue.
movelastsongtofirst.success: Moved `{{title}}` from the last to the top of queue.

news.name: news
news.description: Shows news topics that are currently being distributed.

nowplaying.name: nowplaying
nowplaying.description: Displays information about the currently playing song. An argument of `l` (True for slash commands) displays a longer summary. (if possible)

detailed.description: If set to True, show details as long as possible.

play.name: play
play.description: Plays songs in queue. You can also specify keywords or URLs of songs as an argument.

keyword.description: Keyword or URL of the video to play. If not connected to VC, connect and play that song with priority. Adds to the end of the queue if it is connected. If paused, the option is ignored and playback resumes.

audiofile.description: You can upload and listen to supported audio files.

play.queueEmpty: Queue is empty. No content to play.

play_private.description: Adds a new song from the URL to queue secretly, and starts playing if possible.
play_private.noInteraction: Unable to use this command by text-based-message.
play_private.modalTitle: What would you like to play?
play_private.inputLabel: URL of the song you'd like to play.

queue.name: queue

page.description: You can specify which page of queues to display.

queue.pageOutOfRange: The page you provided is out of the range.

radio.name: radio
radio.description: Starts or stops a radio (mix list) based on the specified URL of the song. If you specified nothing, starts a new radio from the current playing song.

url.description: URL on YouTube of the song that the radio is based on.

radio.alreadyEnabled: The radio is already enabled. If you want to start a new radio based on another song, you need to disable the mix list that is currently played at first.
radio.noUrlSpecified: Provide a URL of the song that the radio will be based on.
radio.invalidUrl: The provided URL is not valid one on YouTube.
radio.started: Started a radio based on the specified song.
radio.startedFromCurrentSong: Started a radio based on the current playing song.

related.name: related
related.description: Enables/disables the function that automatically adds related songs to queue when a song from YouTube finishes playing.
related.featureDescription: This is a function that automatically adds related songs to the end of the queue when a song from YouTube finishes playing.
related.featureNote: \* Nothing will be added when playing songs not from YouTube, or loop enabled.

remove.name: remove
remove.description: Removes the specified songs in queue.
remove.usage: remove <the position of the song you want to remove>

index.description: The index to be removed is the one that is listed with the queue. You can also use hyphen to specify a range like 2-5, or spaces to specify multiple like 1 4 8.

remove.noArgument: Enter the offset (number) of the song to be removed in the argument.
remove.invalidArgument: Unable to remove the current playing song.
remove.unableToRemoveAt: Unable to remove the songs at position {{indexes}} due to lack of permission.
remove.unableToRemoveMany: Unable to remove some specified songs due to lack of permission.
remove.unableToRemoveAll: No items could be removed. You may not satisfy the required permission to remove the requested songs.

removeall.name: removeall
removeall.description: Removes all items from queue. (will disconnect from the voice channel if connected to.)

removedupes.name: removedupes
removedupes.noSongRemoved: No duplicated songs that can be deleted.

reset.name: reset
reset.description:
Resets all the data such as queue, settings and any other data. Specify true as an argument to preserve queue.
\* The bot will disconnect from the voice channel if connected to.

preservequeue.description: Specify True to keep the queue. If this does not solve the problem, specify False and try again.

search.name: search
search.description: Shows a list of songs that match the search query on YouTube.

keyword.description: Keyword or URL of the video you want to search for.
Keyword or URL of the song you want to search for.

searchqueue.name: searchqueue
searchqueue.description: Searches in queue. Specify keywords for the argument.

keyword.description: Keyword of the song you want to search for

searchqueue.embedDescription: Search results in queue. Up to 20 items are displayed.

searchsoundcloud.name: searchsoundcloud
searchsoundcloud.description: Shows a list of songs that match the search query on SoundCloud.

keyword.description: Keyword or URL of the song you want to search for.

seek.name: seek
seek.description: Seeks to a certain point in the current playing song.
seek.unseekable: The current playing song is not seek-able.

skip.name: skip
skip.description: Skips the current playing song or shows skip vote according to the situation.
skip.preparing: Unable to skip due to preparing to play a song now.
skip.votePanelAlreadyOpen: There's already another skip vote opened.

thumbnail.name: thumbnail
thumbnail.description: Shows the thumbnail of the current playing song. When a search result is opened and provided a number in the result, shows the thumbnail of the specified song.
thumbnail.usage: thumbnail [a number in a search result]

index.description: If you specify an index in the search result, the thumbnail of that item will be displayed.

thumbnail.noSearchPanelFound: There are no thumbnails to show.

volume.name: volume
volume.description: Changes the volume. Set between 1 and 200. (The default value is 100.) When you provide no argument, shows the current volume. If it becomes unstable, set the volume to 100.
The volume you change to. Set between 1 and 200.

volume.outOfRange: Please provide the value between 1 and 200.
volume.appliedFromNext: It will be applied from the next song. If you'd like to apply to the current playing song, use command `rewind`.
